descr: "Details and position information for a physical place where services are provided  and resources and participants may be stored, found, contained or accommodated."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a Location resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Unique code or number identifying the location to its users."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "The status property covers the general availability of the resource, not the current value which may be covered by the operationStatus, or by a schedule/slots if they are configured for the location."

fields.name: operationalStatus
fields.descr: "The Operational status covers operation values most relevant to beds (but can also apply to rooms/units/chair/etc such as an isolation unit/dialisys chair). This typically covers concepts such as contamination, housekeeping and other activities like maintenance."

fields.name: name
fields.descr: "Name of the location as used by humans. Does not need to be unique."

fields.name: alias
fields.descr: "A list of alternate names that the location is known as, or was known as in the past."

fields.name: description
fields.descr: "Description of the Location, which helps in finding or referencing the place."

fields.name: mode
fields.descr: "Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations."

fields.name: type
fields.descr: "Indicates the type of function performed at the location."

fields.name: telecom
fields.descr: "The contact details of communication devices available at the location. This can include phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and web sites."

fields.name: address
fields.descr: "Physical location."

fields.name: physicalType
fields.descr: "Physical form of the location, e.g. building, room, vehicle, road."

fields.name: position
fields.descr: "The absolute geographic location of the Location, expressed using the WGS84 datum (This is the same co-ordinate system used in KML)."

fields.name: managingOrganization
fields.descr: "The organization responsible for the provisioning and upkeep of the location."

fields.name: partOf
fields.descr: "Another Location which this Location is physically part of."

fields.name: endpoint
fields.descr: "Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the location."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: meta
fields.descr:
"The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: implicitRules
fields.descr:
"A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: language
fields.descr:
"The base language in which the resource is written."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

searches.name: address
searches.descr: A (part of the) address of the location

searches.name: addresscity
searches.descr: A city specified in an address

searches.name: addresscountry
searches.descr: A country specified in an address

searches.name: addresspostalcode
searches.descr: A postal code specified in an address

searches.name: addressstate
searches.descr: A state specified in an address

searches.name: addressuse
searches.descr: A use code specified in an address

searches.name: endpoint
searches.descr: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the location

searches.name: name
searches.descr: A portion of the location's name or alias

searches.name: near
searches.descr:
The coordinates expressed as [latitude]:[longitude] (using the WGS84 datum, see notes) to find locations near to (servers may search using a square rather than a circle for efficiency)

Requires the near-distance parameter to be provided also

searches.name: neardistance
searches.descr:
A distance quantity to limit the near search to locations within a specific distance

Requires the near parameter to also be included

searches.name: operationalstatus
searches.descr: Searches for locations (typically bed/room) that have an operational status (e.g. contaminated, housekeeping)

searches.name: organization
searches.descr: Searches for locations that are managed by the provided organization

searches.name: partof
searches.descr: A location of which this location is a part

searches.name: status
searches.descr: Searches for locations with a specific kind of status

searches.name: type
searches.descr: A code for the type of location
